channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6405] Create Hadoop compatibilty modules and Metrics2 implementation of replication metrics
item.summary: Create Hadoop compatibilty modules and Metrics2 implementation of replication metrics

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Same patch as 4050-8.patch from Elliot.

Integrated to trunk.

Thanks for the patch, Elliot.

Thanks for the review, Stack.
Thanks

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3141 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3141/)

I also filed: HBASE-6415 as it looks like trunk has been broken on rat for a while and the pre-commit hooks didn't alert us when the broken checkin was committed.

Addendum checked in.

Thanks for the quick turn-around, Elliot.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3142 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3142/)
HBASE-6405 Addendum fixes RAT checking (Elliot Clark) (Revision 1362696)

Result = FAILURE
tedyu :
Files :

  • /hbase/trunk/pom.xml

Eclipse is having trouble understanding the maven-dependency-plugin usage in hbase-hadoop2-compat. It seems to not be able to find the plugin goal build-classpath with the missing version. Also, the m2e lifecycle mapping needs to be told how to handle the lifecycle.

Attaching patch to fix the above as well as fix formatting on the added modules.
Addendum 2 looks good.

Jesse:
Your added patch fails to compile when compiling for hadoop2. It's pretty important that hbase-hadoop1-compat has an explicit dependency on hadoop1's version of things, and hbase-hadoop2-compat has an explicit dependency on hadoop2 versions. If I add <version>$

{hadoop-one.version}

</version> back in where it was removed things seem to build for me.

Is there some reason that only hbase-hadoop2 has the maven m2e stuff added ?

@Elliot: yeah, I just noticed that it wasn't building - my bad. Adding back in those tags should be fine, but they need to by pulled out of the properties definition in /hbase/pom.xml's hadoop-1.0 profile and just have them reside in the general properties section in /hbase/pom.xml.

Is there some reason that only hbase-hadoop2 has the maven m2e stuff added ?

Yeah, only hadoop2 has the maven-dependency-plugin running to specify the classpath since it is bound to an "interesting" phase. Specifically, from the m2e docs:

m2e 1.0 requires explicit instructions what to do with all Maven plugins bound to "interesting" phases

where 'interesting phases' are defined here: https://docs.sonatype.org/display/M2ECLIPSE/Project+build+lifecycle+mapping

Currently, it ignores the phase when building in eclipse (which is generally fine, considering command line maven is really source of truth). I'm working on a new version that fixes hadoop1 and has the build plugin execute.
Attaching patch that seems to work for me, but the issue raised in HBASE-6421 is breaking the build for me too, so hard to say for sure.

@Elliot: yeah, I just noticed that it wasn't building - my bad. Adding back in those tags should be fine, but they need to by pulled out of the properties definition in /hbase/pom.xml's hadoop-1.0 profile and just have them reside in the general properties section in /hbase/pom.xml.

hadoop-one.version and hadoop-two.version are defined in the global properties phase. The hadoop1 profile just sets the hadoop.version to whatever value hadoop-one.version holds. Likewise hadoop2 profile sets hadoop.version to whatever value hadoop-two.version has.

@Elliot - yeah, RTFS, i know. Just looked it up and realized I had put my foot in my mouth.

What do think of the latest?

+1 looks good to me. Having issues creating the last assembly like everyone else right now. However it compiles and everything looks good. Thanks.
Sorry I broke eclipse :-/

Sorry I broke eclipse :-/

Eclipse is old and busted anyways (too bad everyone and their mother uses it).

+1 looks good to me.

@Ted - good enough for commit?
Will integrate later tonight.

Addendum v2 integrated to trunk.

Thanks for the patch, Jesse.

Thanks for the review, Elliot.
